924FBA910376406585FD7689042B1C64.description: sets goals to improve viewing, listening, speaking and representing.

BD4A1B91F44E467F8454A99A2084D005.description: states appropriate and achievable improvement goals based on self-analysis; chooses and applies strategies appropriate to improvement goals and reflect on progress in achieving those goals; and,

63F7D53F14884C29AB521B916475D25F.description: identifies and analyzes effectiveness of a variety of language strategies;

B35D2A90A8B547D49B1E1E1A18729203.description: appraises own and others' work for clarity;

A4E6580BFAC04A0DA374BD78EFB64EF9.description: generates and uses criteria to self-assess and set goals for improvement as a speaker, presenter, viewer and listener;

D72A0C6C44B648BAA4BA2F3136457C09.description: assesses language use and revises personal goals to enhance language learning and use; reflects on and assesses speaking, listening, representing and viewing experiences and on the selected strategies that learners have used, including criteria relevant to vocabulary to assess their viewing and listening activities; and sets goals for each;

575C14C68BEE4326B676CADFED386A6A.description: considers and uses the strategies appropriate for a given task and situation;

BA9798F54CBC48F38CAE7DBAF06BA7D5.description: develops and uses criteria for evaluating self, setting goals, and preparing an action plan.

F39A53C090374B6FA23FD7609CEE81F1.description: evaluates the quality of own contributions to group process and sets goals using a selfevaluation tool (created by self or with peers and/or teacher) and plans for development; and,

E673E556ED4946F5ABF6C8DFD31AE915.description: reflects on identity through the Michif world-view and language by asking questions; "How does my use of Michif shape the way I understand my environments? Or how does my use of Michif shape the way I understand the Michif culture?" explains how speaking, listening and viewing are useful tools to clarify thinking, communicating and learning;

AEE8BFAF53094E5195AB0CBBA7BDD6D9.description: assess personal strengths and needs for language learning as they relate to family, community and land.

9CC11512652C42448463297F0434E741.description: outlines similarities and differences between people, objects or situations; e.g., compare the Michif and Cree terms.

CA6810DBE3AE496ABBEE7CE84B9FB7C8.description: describes events and experiences in logical progression, such as how birch syrup is gathered in spring, or how to set a fish net, or how different groups of people interacted with one another on the plains and in the north; and,

E2EFA78F861545C6B05AD0757BE415A0.description: explains a procedure: describes what is done and why, such as how and why people heat their drums before they play, or why tobacco is left in the ground when resources are utilized from the land;

A2EF7694858F43CB8D91237716C524CF.description: perform language functions that allow learners to produce communication.

389BCBFD7502409ABAFB3CA7B8A9E126.description: conducts a language survey as a class or group project to survey Michif speakers on language.

DFACE3137D234123B918EFF0353C2FA5.description: records information in various forms, such as written, visual, or audio puts information to use by preparing a project, representing, or planning for an outing; and,

A92B1FC22B524384BB82D6AA7204CFB3.description: organizes, condenses and summarizes data by using webs, charts, drawings and other visual representations;

712C52D624C04942AB945BDC4E3BF77E.description: processes information by listening to instructions on how to do a particular task or follow directions;

4A3C1A67DA074D99A768AA910DA6E890.description: decides where and how to find information including print and non-print resources such as: interviewing people with specific simple questions; internet, DVDs, TV, radio, resource people; library, book store, trading post, store.

020044482AD5402587752DEC94743B6F.description: discusses and plans ways to obtain information or assistance from peers, helpers, leaders in the community for a variety of purposes (ask for assistance or guidance from others);

15CCD738581644D9A95633277AE48718.description: Perform language functions that allow learners to inquire.

2104D41EDA6543F68E1B5C177156459A.description: relates personally to a character or situation in moral stories using a comparison chart or Venn diagram.

3C03F20ACD5B4559B5F565C739BA4AAA.description: recognizes and explains language techniques used for effectiveness, such as accompanying songs, clarity of vocabulary chosen using visual representation such as illustrations, graphs, accessories; and,

3FE5A486D183468392595330D70F2846.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: compiles and organizes details, such as the sequence of events or steps; examines causes and effects of decisions made by characters; and, identifies and describes the main character(s), the main problem or the purpose;

FFCF6F0BF7FE49A881A192F92D9A58B0.description: predicts what the discourse will be about using background knowledge about subject or from previewing and pre-listening activities directed by the teacher;

80F1C8C2AF514D04AA6E80E9B9E0F409.description: interpret discourse by choosing the appropriate language function.

EDE1A8395E0E47DDAA3B2A2BDF9441C6.description: prepares an event following the order of a ceremony and recognize placement of participants.

1D8D15A44F9B44A98868E218D05FBE58.description: uses appropriate register in speaking to a person of the opposite sex (through role-play or simulations); and,

65DB87D2A8204C1E866AB4225C3787F7.description: prepares in groups, topics that will be discussed and questions that can be asked when Elders are present to share their knowledge;

276624127B3D40FE84C713D5965D5F9B.description: expresses basic personal emotions and circumstances;

F2B63F9186484E2D94A787CA8EE7A54C.description: recognizes gestures and expressions that accompany requests from friends, adults, unfamiliar adults;

8653CC772D6342A69B257C6550105AF3.description: gives instructions in a polite way according to conventions of the language and community;

F9B9DF2C71D541BDBFC4863FA43C4F0F.description: uses expressions and phrases for informal conversation in cooperative groups;

2B2B370434C04E3AA3F47D9F6EC242B0.description: uses gestures and expressions that accompany play;

E575837A09024AE68EE1BB1B78C22AFF.description: socialize and celebrate by choosing the appropriate language function.

A86F275E46DA497FAC8E33C788480B8C.description: participates in conversations that include past, present and future actions and events.

A6AA3E5B2DA44EED8B811DA97994C883.description: exchanges and shares opinions, preferences, and shares justification; and,

F1E6D8151C38428FBA21DF0725A21F42.description: follows instructions involving several objects and actions (learning to dance, jig, or prepare food);

F6D493D87E9843DDBC410698DC7987D5.description: asks for and responds to questions about logical relations: cause, conditional, contrast, conjunction; e.g., "Where is our mother?."; asks for specific help and completes task;

2FE68D8F6E364D20AFB60E33AED9808F.description: asks for and responds to questions of clarification about "who did what to whom";

90739103F4B542BD8C9F9E612C121FD0.description: asks for and responds to questions of clarification about action or movement: frequency, duration, direction; e.g., Which way to Canoe river?;

04B5F3BD040A4909A4E1D41802CF5AC7.description: asks for and responds to questions of clarification about objects: directions, prices, purpose, location. Where is the store?;

994D02CBBAD245BB937B28770A4B78E6.description: uses learned expressions in a variety of contexts;

7749DD0CD97A4F4BAB0D05D3F35A9CB2.description: explores and uses formal and informal Michif and behaviours in a variety of contexts;

FD3EEC4DB5E5455C985582A08EC701C3.description: uses a combination of simple social interaction patterns to perform transactions and interactions (e.g., invitation, accepting, nonaccepting, explaining, extending, and writing) specific to the Michif culture;

402BEB51955343928428973FB6FDC202.description: receive and give information by choosing the appropriate language function.

01070F4462CA458A83228F5035198E3C.description: gives examples of various words and expressions that convey the same idea.

52AC47C761E94C01A40A9A19E2ED61E6.description: sequences elements of a simple story, process or series of events; and,

7D6BC2265457462BAE9DAA7E20B6203E.description: links words or groups of words in simple ways;

0291FAEC4C2140FFBFEB39821821C3F7.description: produces several responses to simple questions and answers simple questions in several different ways;

DDD1770F9829428AAF1B9CFAECBE6AEA.description: produces several sentences using basic words, phrases, short sentences, and questions, and simple language structures;

401CFC5FCC8144678514659F1F45C9C8.description: produces, with preparation, several sentences in oral and written form, using such linking words as "aspin -then, m'wîstas - after" and osâm - because";

E0417760ED6F4A97A581A9466B807549.description: produces several sentences spontaneously to express an idea, using coherency markers;

1A015D7D783C458680FD482FA54F927C.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within communication).

CDE1B749FDA54C86B88EF312191A0580.description: produces short, simple oral texts independently or with guidance from the teacher.

4ADC306FCAB040B2AC8DA75D78C7D050.description: manages short interactions with classmates with ease; and,

13D38B705776414BA88D2483FD4B41EA.description: uses intonation, stress, and rhythm appropriately in classroom situations;

E0D0449B49F7429FB53505B422400564.description: gives examples of various words or expressions that convey the same idea;

14F8E4242B2E477B87CAF1658545862C.description: demonstrates awareness that one word may have multiple meanings depending on the context;

106709CB4B55461D9D4C8315C0959592.description: takes risks in pronunciation of unfamiliar words;

3D1D64644BAE4370B70967DCF49E4616.description: uses pronunciation and grammar that is understandable in familiar situations;

BE1281780AD447DA98FC31FEC5669D2C.description: uses Michif in most common and basic situations of the classroom (using precise verbs such as, api - sit, nakamo - sing, pahpi - laugh";

C34055A1B2724BA0905A22253466DB62.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency is the ability of an individual to speak or perform in an acquired language).

0087E8253AFB4711B76E3D0B998C848A.description: uses a repertoire of words and phrases in the classroom within a variety of lexical fields such as; world of work, living things, shopping, extracurricular activities, plants and seasons, entertainment.

D02A492F1071432EB1784DB7EABB4CA4.description: enunciates words independently and confidently; and,

FE8CE59F020242778A0A12EEB6D39055.description: identifies and explains complex syntactical and semantical elements of the language;

91A238398AF2456093BF55FD85EE0B5A.description: identifies and explains a variety of references (nouns, verbs, space, time) within texts;

5DADC85C006946B58626E9ADCE76FD18.description: presents steps of a procedure or follows directions;

4BAC9EDAE65B4F509D10EDFE4023211A.description: identifies the main point and supporting details of short texts on familiar topics in guided situations;

F05BED9AD5AC4D5FB9C9C1A2D7F6C028.description: listens and responds to a variety of short, simple oral sentences in situations by answering or questioning when the opportunity presents itself, for example: tânsi kiya? How are you? namôya nân'taw. I am fine.";

9AAE050DADE04AC4B97F3A14FE97D5BA.description: uses correct word order in short utterances and basic constructions;

EDD27BB43EDB4AB6B1530C6052FB31D7.description: uses common regular verbal affixes with accuracy such as transitive and intransitive verbs. Transitive Animate Verb (VTA) niwâpamâw -I see him/her (animate)" and Transitive Inanimate Verbs (VTI) "niwâpahtîn~I see it (inanimate)";

5775D65709264071AFFA2E0A4EEA4386.description: understands and uses specific vocabulary associated with his or her daily life when (e.g., interacting with classmates, teacher, composing a written assignment and presenting orally);

95E06B237FFE4AF5AE99B3736D66C3C6.description: communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy primarily the syntactical and semantical connections of a language).

60411C4FA0EF491780645E31D39FFF2B.description: uses note taking to write down key terms or concepts (e.g., split page notes, write down key term on one side and meaning of the term on the other).

9B8465E0A80344B989222054F0BE61D6.description: uses support strategies to help peers persevere at learning task; and,

C85477151CE240ACB61E3E1139D25745.description: works with others to monitor own language learning (e.g., peers, teachers);

3783DF6ACE1045AF97BEC49917F66CE4.description: summarizes the point reached in a discussion to help focus a task;

D5E039BB59EE4852B79A8C71E2B949EA.description: repeats part of what someone has said to confirm mutual understanding;

7F5FF108DDE4479BA76101E9FEADBF87.description: uses suitable phrases to intervene in a discussion (e.g., What do you think about...? Could you tell me more about...? I wonder about...?");

4934998916E445CB9EA840576B5E8E11.description: takes part in group decision-making by informing and sharing with others suggestions one has;

BD969F86000B4A6E9D28B0F8B3E8F880.description: formulates key questions to guide inquiry;

129CC5A6FEE449519C1FA82721D236D2.description: assesses own performance or comprehension at the end of a task by answering questions such as "did I ask an entire question or did I answer the question correctly? What other way could I have said what I did?";

C6A3ED54D8EB41BE9D672944BFD036D0.description: divides the overall learning task into sub-tasks, for example when learning weather terms break down the term to root word, prefix and suffix;

8FE4ABF35EA54A68882788E99A3C0E44.description: distinguishes between fact and opinion of Michif perspectives when using a variety of sources of information (Elders, books, archives, television, World Wide Web);

FF03F784469044C4B92EA424BA070816.description: identifies areas of personal difficulty and decides on a plan of how to resolve the problem;

6041EDAC14D24C3D93428E34E4D1CAC2.description: analyzes an unfamiliar word through its word parts and the context to comprehend;

2B0EE30998C048B8B56C08463932FFB4.description: creates word webs, tables and other graphic organizers in order to remember groups of words or patterns;

4453492504B14241BA7278CA4F7C86C5.description: uses words and expressions in different ways when intended language is not available;

69354D2921E64F85AEC3AF2736477F39.description: sustains prolonged interaction with pauses to formulate oral text and to self-correct;

1208828719484DEA82E5C58C25AAF87E.description: risks errors by pushing own language boundaries;

FA9FBA5BA1194010A2F7D7B24632C45C.description: plans what and how to communicate a message in every day conversations;

57E44A2F33A64BBDA127219D26646AB8.description: asks questions for clarification and recognizes when understanding breaks down;

2F753053F00249DB802D9CA2592634F7.description: identifies the purpose or intent of a message;

F6708875F1944F08ADC2969FCC78B89B.description: focuses on key words to understand information when listening, viewing and reading;

D1633C2721EE4B97AC7119DAB5119245.description: uses available technological aides to support language learning such as the website: www.giftoflanguageandculture.ca, Alberta Elders Cree Dictionary;

9C5E4782256445CB871A6A93E47F398A.description: associates new words or expressions with familiar ones using Michif;

6A2DDF7F9EA242FCBA2FD6B0E034E1DD.description: uses repetition to imitate Michif language when practicing words or phrases;

81F9C877F98F4B358FFB5A31C168797D.description: select and use appropriate strategies to construct meaning and communicate, including language cues and conventions (phonological, semantics, syntactic, pragmatics, graphophonics and morphological).

94C4C9A0AF1E4170983F678BDF9904CF.description: strengthens vocabulary by interacting outdoors to become familiar with the weather and environment.

E614D578D62D46CB8416CCC2F32BB46B.description: builds vocabulary using pictures and props for word recognition; and,

DEDDE5C915404A60A94F9AB66F38BB2E.description: participates in ceremonies or feasts and extracts the words known then discusses the meaning;

5A6F81D42D6343B2A090D5BACBE73803.description: uses nonverbal communication in a variety of contexts (e.g., shrugging shoulders, pointing with lips, etc.);

6740658A2D5248F1AC4973C228A92F30.description: uses politeness conventions in a variety of contexts (e.g., using suitable language to engage listeners' attention when beginning to speak);

22F2FE651BDF4AF99C0572AFD060B424.description: identifies and produces uses of common regional or other variations in the Michif language;

EB95E58F15994C139B779DBAA0A3783E.description: uses expressions to illustrate differences in register (formal vs. informal);

1892E8F551284CB7A9C98DD4F8C05600.description: prepares a visual display of cultural information (e.g., pictures or technology that shows how to prepare food or hides);

8FA27A1099564AC296FCF9E8AC7588EB.description: communicates personal feelings on topics of study or experiences, using a variety of mediums, such as video, art, music, narratives;

F73472AE81F442D5A45097073B3E65A6.description: retells parts of oral narratives using a variety of traditional and contemporary mediums to support the retelling such as, drama, dance, music or visual art;

42725ED4520B474089F78A8ECA3A1407.description: explains and follows rules, routines, and procedures related to a specific activity (classroom, playing a sport, preparing a meal, planning a meeting with others);

05864748376A46809C5440F48C7AEAF9.description: expresses some emotions and feelings familiar to the classroom (by role-playing, talking circles);

40A0F2552B26411AAB20B42CCBC348B9.description: identifies and uses terms related to kinship (e.g., sister, brother, mother, father, motherin-law, father-in-law, etc.,);

DF99888731F24C3AAC57A18A31EEB686.description: produce oral language that is understandable to others

A4E9A479D67E4C04AAB79AFFEB70DC42.description: discusses selected topics providing some details to support main idea.

A7CFD101F32F457FA604258076F2838C.description: responds to the main point and some supporting details of oral texts on a variety of familiar topics guided by the teacher using graphic organizer or flow chart or technology; and,

01B8E9E9FF63405CA6DD274685866B54.description: shares and explains examples of short and simple excerpts using stories from the oral tradition;

E7AC4A3475104DB3921239C7089F65FE.description: uses language for personal enjoyment (create songs, chants, or word games);

7336DD4F4C8C4B708E61F45AD2FA2CC2.description: uses language creatively and for aesthetic purposes (write simple sentences creating situations in a different time or place);

C74441DFA7A04E4C8E013594AAA0F440.description: uses language for fun (e.g., express humour, figures of speech literally (illustrate or present short skits, perform songs, chants, dances, or short plays);

ACD1FBE8B5D740D58812D75FDE068CC4.description: presents oral forms of simple and short contemporary Michif reflections, such as songs, short entertaining films, short stories, recipes using land foods;

53637B87CFE34E9D8D8C6958DC1846ED.description: explains electronically or in person, short and simple oral excerpts from the oral tradition of the people, relating to areas of local lifestyles in the past and present (histories, biographies, moral stories, songs including entertainment stories);

F62EF2CB6FDC4BB5A4590D7AEC505941.description: understand and interpret the Michif language as a connected set of ideas

5714D5B5DCA5411D96783AFA79AA579F.description: responds to representation of ideas, events and information by creating a chart, illustrations or technology.

9674CFA0C5884672B0B0E984E43AE729.description: derives meaning from, and responds to a variety of text forms including storytelling in a variety of media (videotaped instructions or events by creating illustrations, respond in learning logs, or questioning the author);

AA38C6ABB9864222B57E6913595C8F22.description: discusses and promotes positive interactions and relationships in the school by inviting (Elders into the classroom to share with students);

A380919654604B53886E718AE0C7418D.description: participates in developing language and culture during experiential learning opportunities, such as helping at community/cultural events, volunteering with day-care children, visiting and conversing with Elders in the community, planning cultural camps/activities and presents these experiences with classmates and teacher;

29B87154DC0142318B34823AC27E2C0F.description: seeks and records information to further understanding of Michif concepts from Elders and other knowledge keepers within the community (by keeping a journal, transcribing encounters, videotaping interactions, creating a dictionary);

8990C8C0E23E4EF7BF519395B257BA09.description: interacts with classmates in pairs or small groups to plan and complete class projects using the Michif language;

951358BE508D4BAFB6EE03DADA834D79.description: interacts with classmates and teacher respectfully during learning activities using the Michif language;

C7BB4E520A0542DCAAA928112B24B86D.description: view, interact with, and experience the natural and constructed environments of the community.
